Nemeš nastavio žetvu medalja: Znanje kec iz rukava
01 Nov 2019, 16:49 by Zile
Trofejni srpski rvač Viktor Nemeš, nedavno se vratio iz Kine gde je na Svetskim vojnim igrama osvojio još jednu medalju za našu zemlju – ovog puta bronzanu. Prvi slobodan trenutak ovaj vrhunski sportista iz Sente iskoristio je da obavi sve formalnosti oko upisa na četvrtu godinu Fakulteta za sport, koji i pored brojnih sportskih obaveza uspešno pohađa.
Zanimljivo je da je od 2016. godine, od kada je postao stipendista Fakulteta za sport Univerziteta „Union – Nikola Tesla“ Nemeš osvojio čak pet medalja – zlato i bronzu na šampionatima sveta, srebro i bronzu na evropskim prvenstvima i sada bronzu u Vuhanu i tako na najbolji mogući način pokazao kako vrhunska sportska karijera i visoko obrazovanje mogu da idu ruku pod ruku.
Iz kineskog grada Vuhana, hiljadu kilometara severno od Pekinga, sa Svetskih vojnih igara na kojima je prvi put učestvovao, Nemeš se vratio pun utisaka.
– Organizacija je bila na vrhunskom nivou. Bio sam zadivljen onim što sam video. Kinezi su to odradili na maestralan način, a dovoljno je možda samo reći da je kompletna organizacija koštala čak 23 miliona dolara. Izgradili su selo za smeštaj 9.300 sportista koje je bilo neuporedivo bolje, funkcionalnije i modernije od onog koje smo imali na Olimpijskim igrama u Riju. Bilo je angažovano čak 25.000 volontera, na otvaranju igara pevao je slavni glumac Džeki Čen, a toj svečanoj ceremoniji prisustvoao je i predsednik Kine Si Đinping. Kada smo dolazili u Kinu i kada smo se vraćali u Srbiju, na aerdromima smo imali povlašćen status, imali smo poseban protokol, nismo čekali u redovima niti se bilo gde zadržavali. Uz nas je bio uvek neko iz organizacije i lokalni policijski službenik, tako je bilo u Kini, ali i na aerdromima u Minsku i Budipešti. Zaista neverovatno, rekao je Nemeš.



Kada je o samom takmičenju reč, Nemeš je istakao:
– Konkurencija je bila izuzetno jaka. Dovoljno je reći samo da sam u polufinalu izgubio od olimpijskog šampiona Hasana Alijeva iz Azerbejdžana. Međutim, u borbi za treće mesto pobedio sam Ukrajinca koga sam savladao i 2015. godine kada sam osvojio svoju prvu medalju u seniorskoj konkurenciji. Zanimljivo je da od njega nikad nisam izgubio, a već smo radili pet ili šest mečeva.
Ono što predstoji Nemešu su evropske kvalifikacije za plasman na Olimpijske igre.
– Na šampionatu sveta u Kazahstanu nisam uspeo da izborim olimpjsku vizu što mi je bio osnovni cilj. Međutim, bio sam žestoko oštećen od strane sudija u duelu sa domaćim rvačem. Bilo je nekoliko odluka na moju štetu, evidentnih grešaka za koje ne znam da li su bile sa namerom, ali predsednik Svetske rvačke federacije Nenad Lalović mi je sopštio da taj sudija više neće biti delegiran za velika takmičenja. To mi nije neka satisfakcija, ali šta da se radi i to je sport, napravio je malu digresiju Nemeš i potom se vratio na temu.
– Evropske kvalifikacije će biti u martu u Budimpešti. Konkurencija će biti žestoka, jer su do sada samo trojica rvača iz Evrope plasirala na Olimpijske igre, a samo će finalisti obezbediti vizu za Tokio. Reći ću samo da će se u Budimpešti, između ostalih, takmičiti i Roman Vlasov, dvostruki olimpijski šampion.
Pripreme za ovo važno takmičenje Nemeš počinje već početkom decembra.
– Treniraćemo u bugarskom Belmekenu i tamo ćemo sprovesti bazične pripreme. Potrudiću se da pripreme odradim na najbolji mogući način i već u martu obezbedim Olimpijsku vizu. U suprotnom imaću još jednu šansu u aprilu na svetskim kvalifikacijama, kaže Nemeš i otkriva da za pripreme ima specijalnog aduta u rukavu.
– To je znanje za medalje koje stičem na Fakultetu za sport. Na studijskom programu sam Trener u sportu i teorisjko znanje koje stičem svakodnevno proverama u praksi i to mi zaista mnog znači. Već sam mnogo toga naučio, ali pre svega kako da na pravi način osluškujem svoje telo i na osnovu toga kako da pravilno doziram trening. U teoriji sportskog treninga postoji princip svesnosti, po kome sportista treba da zna šta radi, zašto to na treningu radi i kako treba radi. Mislim da sam to dobro izučio i da mi zaista pomaže, zaključio je Nemeš.

You have not resumed harvesting medals: Knowledge ace from the sleeves
01 Nov 2019, 15:49 by Zile
Trophy Serbian wrestler Viktor Nemesh recently returned from China to win another medal for our country at the World War Games - this time a bronze. The first free moment was used by this top athlete from Senta to complete all the formalities for enrollment in the fourth year of the Faculty of Sport, which despite numerous sports commitments.
It is interesting that since 2016, when he became a scholarship holder of the Faculty of Sport of the Union - Nikola Tesla University, Nemesh won as many as five medals - gold and bronze at the world championships, silver and bronze at European championships and now bronze in Vuhan and so demonstrated to the best of his ability a top sports career and higher education can go hand in hand.
From the Chinese city of Wuhan, a thousand kilometers north of Beijing, from the World War I Games he first participated in, Neshesh returned full of impressions.
- The organization was at a top level. I was amazed at what I saw. The Chinese did it in a masterful way, and suffice it to say that the entire organization cost as much as $ 23 million. They built a village to house 9,300 athletes that was far better, more functional and modern than the one we had at the Rio Olympics. As many as 25,000 volunteers were engaged, celebrity actor Jackie Chen sang at the opening of the games, and Chinese President Xi Jinping attended the ceremony. When we came to China and when we were returning to Serbia, we had privileged status at the airfields, we had a special protocol, we did not wait in queues or stay anywhere. With us was always someone from the organization and a local police officer, so it was in China, but also at the airports in Minsk and Budapest. Truly amazing, said Nemesh.



When it comes to the competition itself, Nemesh pointed out:
- The competition was extremely fierce. Suffice it to say that in the semifinals I lost to Olympic champion Hassan Aliyev of Azerbaijan. However, in the battle for third place, I defeated a Ukrainian who I had mastered in 2015 when I won my first medal in the senior competition. Interestingly, I never lost to him, and we've already done five or six matches.
What lies ahead for Nemes are European qualifications for the Olympic Games.
- At the World Championships in Kazakhstan I was not able to get an Olympic visa, which was my main goal. However, I was severely damaged by the judges in a match with a home wrestler. There were a few decisions to my detriment, obvious mistakes that I don't know were intended, but the president of the World Wrestling Federation, Nenad Lalovic, told me that that judge would no longer be delegated to major competitions. It is not a pleasure for me, but what to do and it is a sport, he made a small digression of Nemesh and then returned to the topic.
- The European Qualifications will be in March in Budapest. The competition will be fierce, as so far only three wrestlers from Europe have entered the Olympic Games, and only the finalists will secure a visa for Tokyo. I will only say that Roman Vlasov, a two-time Olympic champion, will compete in Budapest, among others.
Preparations for this important Nemesh competition begin as early as early December.
- We will train in the Bulgarian Belmeken and make basic preparations there. I will do my best to make preparations as best I can and secure an Olympic visa as early as March. Otherwise, I will have another chance in April to qualify for the world qualifiers, Nemes says, revealing that he has a special trump card up his sleeve.
- This is the knowledge for the medals I get from the Faculty of Sport. I am a Coach in Sports and a theoretical knowledge in my study program, which I gain daily practice tests and that really means a lot to me. I have already learned a lot, but first of all, how to listen to my body in the right way and how to properly train my workout. In the theory of sports training there is a principle of awareness, according to which the athlete should know what he is doing, why he is doing it in training and how it should be done. I think I learned it well and that it really helps me, Nemesh concluded.
